titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert Minor Photographs PHOTOS.233
titlestmt.author: David Olson

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-12-11 10:07:29 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.abstract: Robert Minor (1884-1952) was a cartoonist, journalist, and prominent member of the Communist Party of the United States of America. The collection contains two photographs. One photograph depicts Antonio Lombardo, and the other appears to be Robert Minor.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Archives has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain in 120 years after their date of creation.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Robert Minor Photographs; PHOTOS 233; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The provenance of this collection is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 2006.016.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains two photographs. One photograph is signed, "To Comrade 'Bob' Minor, for whom I have the highest revolutionary regard. From, Antonio Lombardo." The other photograph is not labeled, but appears to be Minor himself.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Robert Minor papers are held by Columbia University Libraries.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In 2013, the collection was rehoused and folder title was transcribed.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Robert Minor (1884-1952) was a cartoonist, journalist, and prominent member of the Communist Party of the United States of America.

Communism -- United States.
